Posted By: Kurraga (10/29/2012 7:44:45 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Keep in mind the block before this was mirrodin, one of the strongest blocks in magic history. The kami block suffers from having to tone everything down a notch, to get the game back were it needed to be at.  
  
For being a narrow hoser, it could have cost ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol). But If I was playing in the Kami block, I would definitely use x4 of these in sideboard, if not maindeck.  
  
Also, its weird that this card would not counter [midnight haunting](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=midnight haunting).
posts.html:
Keep in mind the block before this was mirrodin, one of the strongest blocks in magic history. The kami block suffers from having to tone everything down a notch, to get the game back were it needed to be at.

For being a narrow hoser, it could have cost . But If I was playing in the Kami block, I would definitely use x4 of these in sideboard, if not maindeck.

Also, its weird that this card would not counter midnight haunting.
